text: hey everybody thomas joseph here and i
have a kitchen conundrum that i am sure
you have encountered before and that is
a tough flavorless meatball well today
i'm going to show you some tricks and
tips in making a very tender delicious
meatball i had four slices of white
bread crust removed and i've been
tearing this into small pieces
pour half a cup of whole milk over the
bread save a little bit of the milk
because i have a trick for it later so
let this sit and soften for about five
minutes i have two whole eggs here whisk
those together in a small bowl and now
for some flavoring i have lemon zest it
adds a really great bright flavor whisk
it together i have some garlic some
minced garlic that goes in as well salt
and pepper is very important so i have
one and a half teaspoons of salt a
teaspoon of pepper chopped parsley for
really great flavor and now i'm going to
add that milk that i have left over
whisked together and what this does is
it helps to evenly disperse all of the
flavorings amongst the meat and the
cheese and the bread so it helps you in
getting maximum flavor without
overworking all of your meat so put this
off to the side take a fork and flake
the bread up breaking it into smaller
pieces the bread and the eggs those are
two ingredients that help bind the
meatball together they also make the
meatball light and tender so i have a
pound of ground chuck and a pound of
ground pork make sure that you're not
using meat those two mean the leaner the
meat you use the more likely your
meatball is going to turn out to be
tough so I have one onion that is finely
minced one-and-a-half cups of Parmesan
cheese and the egg mixture and now with
my hands mix the ingredients thoroughly
but don't over mix over mixing will
create a very tough meatball one other
tip keep your hands cold
the hotter your hands what happens is it
melts the fat in the meat and that also
can give you a tough meatball my father
would always run his
under cold water whenever he made
meatloaf or meatballs so you can use
that trick or maybe a little bit of ice
water so now this goes into the
refrigerator to chill and rest for about
an hour so I'm using one of my favorite
tools and that is an ice cream scoop
here to portion out and then to shape
into a ball what I like to do is throw
it between my two hands it knocks out
any air pockets and it also shapes it
into a nice round ball so there you go
one perfect meatball now repeat the
process with all of this working quickly
you don't want this to heat up too much
so all of the meatballs are formed and
now it's time for cooking I have a large
saute pan over medium-high heat a little
bit of extra virgin olive oil I'm doing
this on the stovetop today but you can
certainly do this in the oven at a high
temperature to brown the meatballs up
getting that wonderful brown crust don't
overcrowd the pan if you overcrowd
you're going to create steam and they
won't Brown nicely about 1 to 2 minutes
on each side until you have a nice crust
and then we're ready for our next step
so for the second part of the cooking
process
take your seared meatballs and cook them
at a lower temperature I'm doing it in
sauce today but you could certainly
reduce the temperature of your oven and
it will give you the same outcome
so the meatballs have been simmering
they're perfectly cooked through and the
true test here perfectly tender really
flavorful so there you go you have the
foolproof method now for making
meatballs at home adapt this technique
to your favorite recipe and enjoy
